title: Ticket #3499: per job 'Name' mounting
description: This ticket is meant to capture in detail the per-job FUSE mounting.
remarks:
2013-Mar-14 12:31:57 by tstclair:
Following the same semantics as NAMED_CHROOT as it's pretty much the same use case.

Tracking changes in: master-gt3499-fuse

2013-Apr-09 17:42:44 by bbockelm:
Hi Tim,

What was the idea behind cleaning up the mount? Doesn't the kernel do this automatically?

Brian

2013-Dec-18 15:12:00 by tannenba:
Even though code appears in v8.0.0, am I changing the target release on ticket to v8.1.4. By v8.1.4, we should either revert the commits or address the fact that there is no documentation, no version history, no design document, no code review, no notes on how testing was (or even should be) done, and no answers to thoughtful questions in ticket remarks (like why are umounts are being performed in the code -vs- just letting the kernel do it). I am not against the idea in general of what this ticket is trying to do, but it seems like the develop and release process broke down here.

Do we know if anyone is using this or relies upon it? I.e. is there downstream documentation on the new knobs such that downstream users are potentially using the functionality?

2013-Dec-20 08:44:31 by tstclair:
It was intended to allow auto-fuse-mounting per job. It would be a highly useful feature for other folks, similar to his chirp mods.

You may wish to consult BrianB about it. Presently I'm tasked on other things.
